thread.title: Report: Texas woman sues Popeyes over flesh-eating worms she was allegedly served - The Advocate
thread.title_full: Report: Texas woman sues Popeyes over flesh-eating worms she was allegedly served - The Advocate

title: Report: Texas woman sues Popeyes over flesh-eating worms she was allegedly served - The Advocate
text:
Report: Texas woman sues Popeyes over flesh-eating worms she was allegedly served ADVOCATE STAFF REPORT Feb 11, 2017 - 10:22 pm ( … ) 
Advocate file photo 
A San Antonio woman has filed a lawsuit against Popeyes after a fast food nightmare became reality. 
She says she was served food infested with flesh-eating screwworms, which then laid eggs in her small intestine, according to a report from The San Antionio Express News . 
When the eggs hatched, they infested her body and began to eat her “alive from the inside-out,” according to the report. 
It was unclear exactly when the woman, Karen Goode, consumed the meal in question, but Popeyes spokeswoman Renee Kopowski told The Express news she believed it was about 18 months ago. The woman's attorney said she became ill and couldn't work, losing her business, home and vehicles. 
“For about a year and a half she wasn’t able to do much of anything,” her lawyer said to the Express News. 
Goode's lawyer said she had photographs of the screwworms in the Popeyes container. 
New World screwworms are fly larvae or maggots that are typically found in Florida and generally infest livestock or other animals, according to a Department of Food and Agriculture report . Human infestations are rare, but not unheard of, according to the report. 
Kopowski said Popeyes is working with Goode to address her concerns, according to the report, but declined to comment on the ongoing litigation. 
The New Orleans-born chicken company faced another lawsuit months ago, after a Mississippi man sued the restaurant chain after choking on a piece of chicken because he wasn't given the proper utensils. In the lawsuit, he said he was given a spork, but he needed a knife. Related 
GULFPORT, Miss. (AP) — A Mississippi attorney has dropped his lawsuit against Popeyes Louisi… 
The man later dropped the lawsuit, citing "extreme comments" directed toward his family.
